005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandGroupBase.registerGroupedCommands;
008import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandGroupBase.requireUngrouped;
009
010/**
011 * A command that runs another command in perpetuity, ignoring that command's end conditions. While
012 * this class does not extend {@link CommandGroupBase}, it is still considered a CommandGroup, as it
013 * allows one to compose another command within it; the command instances that are passed to it
014 * cannot be added to any other groups, or scheduled individually.
015 *
016 * <p>As a rule, CommandGroups require the union of the requirements of their component commands.
017 *
018 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
019 *
020 * @deprecated PerpetualCommand violates the assumption that execute() doesn't get called after
021 *     isFinished() returns true -- an assumption that should be valid. This was unsafe/undefined
022 *     behavior from the start, and RepeatCommand provides an easy way to achieve similar end
023 *     results with slightly different (and safe) semantics.
024 */
025@Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "2023")
026public class PerpetualCommand extends CommandBase {
027  protected final Command m_command;
028
029  /**
030   * Creates a new PerpetualCommand. Will run another command in perpetuity, ignoring that command's
031   * end conditions, unless this command itself is interrupted.
032   *
033   * @param command the command to run perpetually
034   */
035  public PerpetualCommand(Command command) {
036    requireUngrouped(command);
037    registerGroupedCommands(command);
038    m_command = command;
039    m_requirements.addAll(command.getRequirements());
040  }
041
042  @Override
043  public void initialize() {
044    m_command.initialize();
045  }
046
047  @Override
048  public void execute() {
049    m_command.execute();
050  }
051
052  @Override
053  public void end(boolean interrupted) {
054    m_command.end(interrupted);
055  }
056
057  @Override
058  public boolean runsWhenDisabled() {
059    return m_command.runsWhenDisabled();
060  }
061}
